message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the different forms of water. Water vapor is the gaseous form of water, and the most common visible example of water vapor is aerial clouds. Option (B) is incorrect because snow is the solid form of water. Option (C) is incorrect because cigarette clouds are not water vapor, but rather smoke. Option (D) is incorrect because ice is the solid form of water.

This question requires knowledge about the different forms of water and their appearance. Water vapor is the gaseous form of water that is not visible to the naked eye. However, when water vapor condenses and forms tiny water droplets or ice crystals in the atmosphere, it becomes visible as clouds. So, option (A) is the correct answer as aerial clouds are a visible example of water vapor. Option (B) is incorrect because snow is the solid form of water, not water vapor. Option (C) is incorrect because cigarette smoke is not water vapor but rather the combustion products from tobacco. Option (D) is incorrect because ice is the solid form of water, not water vapor.

Option (D), ice, is incorrect because it is the solid form of water.
